Their evolution has led to a convergence of male and female traits, yet they haven't completely turned into a single-gender race yet. Males are characterized by a large penis and more muscular features, while females are generally smaller and have no penis. Both genders have milk-producing breasts, a vagina, and a working uterus.<br><br> The Antari mating system is complicated, influenced by primal evolution and advanced culture. Every Antari is born male. As they grow up, individuals become weaker or stronger based on exposure to environmental natural selection. The stronger males end up dominating the weaker males through copulation. Once ejaculate touches the Rhomboid organ located deep within the vaginal canal, an explosive reaction takes place which leads to a gender change of the individual. The penis rapidly shrinks, and the muscles atrophy slightly. The organic mass flows to the breasts and buttocks, leading to a gender transformation into female.<br><br> Another part of the reaction is that an aggressive region of the brain becomes inactivated, leading to submissive behavior and sometimes a dependence of the female on their male dominator.<br><br> Various methods are used by Antari males to dominate one another. The most common is outright physical domination through strength. However, Antari have been known to trick each other using subterfuge or lying to gain the upper hand. Others rely on speed and agility to outmaneuver their opponent.<br><br> Antari culture has evolved a moral code to reduce the conflict generated by this gender-swapping system. It is generally seen as pathetic or uncivilized for males to try and dominate as many others as possible, although it does still happen in rural or undeveloped areas of Antari space. In the higher echelons of society, there are rituals whereupon two males fight in an arena and use 'moral' tactics to try and convert each other. The victor marries the vanquished and, after child production, the male undergoes surgery to prevent further sperm production. The male vigilantly protects the female against any further insemination.<br><br> Deep within Antari society, in the most hedonistic and sheltered circles, some Antari practice various perverted bastardizations of this ritual. Two Antari may ejaculate into each other simultanously, causing a dual gender swap while becoming submissive to each other. Some Antari take their own sperm and inject it into their own vagina, willingly changing gender. These practices are seen as perverse and dangerous, because any subsequent male insemination is capable of triggering submissiveness and dependency.<br><br> Various disorders are associated with failures of each step of the gender transformation process. For instance, Temeter Syndrome is a result of the aggressive portion of the brain failing to shut down, which causes a newly converted Antari female to not accept their dominator.<br><br> =End Log=<br><br> <<if previous() == "Engineering">> [[Continue->Engineering]] <<else>> <<back>> <<endif>> <br> <<overlay>> <br><font size = 4> ''=Archive='' </font> <br> This room is completely filled on one side with rackmount servers. A screen stretches across one wall - it must be the access console.<br> <span id="WermArchive"> <<click "Parasite 2 - Werm">> <<replace "#WermArchive">> <font size = 4> Case file for engineered parasite bioweapon: ''werm'' </font> //''Protozoid'' - excellence through evolution//<br> Trematoda-class parasite that burrows into vaginal openings and integrates itself with the host. Causes hormonal imbalances. Alters the host for its agenda of propagation by increasing libido and arousal. Incubates in host womb and replicates, then spreads to others via sexual intercourse.<br> [img[$image_dir+"Parasites/Werm.png"]]<br> The tendrils on the rear of the parasite can merge with the host flesh and integrate themselves into the nervous system. In females, the target is the clittoral nervous system around the vaginal walls. The entire parasite thus becomes part of the hosts clittoral sensory system. It flattens itself against the inner, upper vaginal wall and heavily stimulates the host whenever they are penetrated. It can also fill itself with fluid and project its body out of the vaginal canal. Penetration using the parasite as a cock results in extreme clittoral stimuli for the host. Lesser minds are consumed by pleasure.<br> When inserted into the anal cavity of males, it goes through a similar process except it networks with the prostate instead of the clittoral system.<br> If the parasite is inserted into the oral cavity, it slides down into the stomach.<br> In all cases, the werm excretes fluids changing the pH and chemical composition of its environment, making it more suitable for birthing. Reproduction of the werm itself occurs more efficiently than other parasite types as well. The werm can inject spawn into any cavity it penetrates during copulation. It can also be fertilized by haploid genetic material. <</replace>> <</click>> </span> <br> <span id="CanalArchive"> <<click "Mutation 12 - Canal">> <<replace "#CanalArchive">> <font size = 4> Case file for engineered parasite bioweapon: ''canal'' </font> //''Protozoid'' - excellence through evolution//<br> Cymothoidae-class parasite that invades body cavities. Small fleshy hooks burrow into the host and meld with the flesh, consuming part of the hosts body and replacing the original orifice. Once inside the host the front and rear of each parasite open up to create a canal allowing air, fluids, or solids to pass through. The parasite consumes part of the material passing through the orifice. Once the original orifice has been completely replaced, the parasite creates urges to pass more material through the respective orifice by releasing hormones directly into the hosts bloodstream. The canal is capable of folding itself back into the infested orifice, like a flower or anenome, to prevent discovery. It is hypothesized that the detection process relies on sensing changes via integration with the hosts nervous system.<br> [img[$image_dir+"Parasites/Canal.png"]]<br> Upon being fertilized by appropriate haploid genetic material the parasite goes through the reproductive process, splitting off a section of itself along the inner wall which matures and eventually exits the host.<br> Movement is still limited, the legs were shortened by design to make them more compatible with large mammal orifices but this reduced their range of motion. These parasites cannot walk but are still capable swimmers. <</replace>> <</click>> </span> <br> <span id="ChokerArchive"> <<click "Mutation 19 - Choker">> <<replace "#ChokerArchive">> <font size = 4> Case file for engineered parasite mutation: ''choker'' </font> //''Protozoid'' - excellence through evolution//<br> This parasite type is the closest we have gotten to the original project mission. Six werms can fuse together to create a Pediculus-class parasite that burrows into the neck, inducing the growth of a canal directly into the brain. It anchors itself around the neck using modified legs which resemble tentacles covered in cilli. Attaches itself to the host brain and induces sexual urges to reproduce as well as feelings of inadequacy and submission. Alters the body of the host slowly over time.<br> The parasite must fully merge with the host before it can be fertilized.<br> [img[$image_dir+"Parasites/Neck.png"]]<br> It infests a host rapidly and reliably. This mutation influences the attitude of host organisms, making them desire to breed above all else. When infesting Antari, the choker is often completely covered by hair and remains concealed. Short haired individuals would be at risk for exposure. The parasites apparently understand this and induce hair growth in some, but not all instances. The criteria for hair growth are unknown at this time.<br> These parasites are responsible for low-level mind control, and are the best candidate strain to be pursued for pacification of dissent. There is only one glaring flaw. These parasites create a tube that links to the brain. It has been observed that werm parasites can use this tube to directly link to the brain of a host. ''If a werm uses the choker for brain infestation, the choker loses its ability to produce eggs.'' The only way to create more choker parasites without fertilization ability is to merge werms under very specific conditions.<br> <</replace>> <</click>> </span> <br> <span id="EggArchive"> <<click "Choker Eggs">> <<replace "#EggArchive">> <font size = 4> Case file for engineered parasite mutation: ''Choker Eggs'' </font> //''Protozoid'' - excellence through evolution//<br> The choker parasites became particularly difficult to gestate, leading the design team to consider a different form of growth cycle. These parasites are birthed from eggs.<br> [img[$image_dir+"Parasites/Egg.png"]]<br> Propagation occurs after fertilization with haploid genetic material. There isn't enough room for the parasite to give live birth, maybe because of the proximity to the host brain. Eggs are rapidly laid in clusters. The eggs must be incubated in a specific environment, limiting their usefulness. We've been able to program a workaround. The werms are capable of creating an incubation environment for the eggs. Storing choker eggs in a werm-infested orifice will allow them to hatch. <</replace>> <</click>> </span> <br> <span id="StarArchive"> <<click "Mutation 22 - Starfish">> <<replace "#StarArchive">> <font size = 4> Case file for engineered parasite bioweapon: ''star'' </font> //''Protozoid'' - excellence through evolution//<br> Another Pediculus-class mutation that burrows into the chest and alters it. Three werms fuse together to create this lineage. It anchors itself around the nipples using strong suction cups and tunnels into the host body, creating an orifice and incubation chamber. The parasite begins mutating the chest to store more fat while growing larger. I hate parasites in the real world, but the level of perceived sexual stimulation is fascinating. It may be related to the definition of parasites themselves.<br> Parasitic relationships are defined as one organism benefitting while the other organism loses. This is in contrast to symbiotic behavior - where both organisms benefit. Parasites are only appealing when combined with the concept of 'inflicted pleasure', the concept of being pleasured against your will. You see this idea in a lot of porn, because it's awesome to get what you want without having to work for it and everyone writing porn knows that. A parasite which pleasures you as it's 'ill effect' is, in fact, actually being symbiotic and this may be why parasite porn is plagued with terrible storylines, because to the intelligent writer it's not truly parasitic unless it's hurting you and if it's hurting you it's not attractive/arousing.<br> Therefore it seems reasonable to say that nobody actually enjoys //parasite// porn, but rather //symbiote// porn that disguises itself as parasitism. It's similar to how some 'submissive' people don't actually want to be submissive, they just want to have things they like forced upon them without any guilt attached.<br> Some people who rely on sexual attraction for survival are parasitic. Sexual attraction is often abused to help one person at someone elses expense. The concept has been fetishized by businessmen who gain pleasure from sending money to hot women for nothing in return.<br> https://www.thrillist.com/entertainment/nation/i-make-200k-a-year-demanding-money-from-men-online<br> This type of parasitism fetish requires a sense of empathy to be appealing. The victim needs to be //in the mind of the parasite// to experience it's pleasure. This is one way empathy can hurt you. It also kind of explains why so many empathetic women are preyed upon by deadbeat guys.<br> Another aspect of parasitism is that desiring to be the victim of a parasite undermines nature, which is itself a fetish. Giving a big middle finger to the universe is appealing to those who believe that nature is constantly trying to kill us all. You start fiddling with the touchscreen, which is, to your horror, entirely in an alien language. You search for a language function. A drop-down menu appears with a vast catalogue of strange, foreign symbols, but you are otherwise out of options. Deep down the list, you find a United Nations symbol. You glance back at the squirming guards, now freely engaging in all manner of parasitic debauchery with each other and your human minions. They were just a skeleton crew, almost two dozen others had the day off. This couldn’t have been better-timed. If you had invaded any other day, the garrison probably would have overwhelmed you.<br><br> Your attention wanders back to the console. A closer look at the project summaries betrays the true purpose of the facility. This is a biological weapons factory to be used by Antari against their own kind. The weapon in question, to your surprise, is the Werm Program. A relatively new development, the Werm is a biological superweapon in its beta-testing phase. Though Earth is not explicitly mentioned, the files describe “test planets” which the Werm was to be unleashed upon to study its efficacy. Upon completion of the test runs, all evidence of the bioweapon was purged from the planet’s surface. Until you.<br><br> Further reading sheds light on the motivation behind such a dangerous and powerful creation the Werm represent. There are evidently thirty-five “core worlds” in the Antari Empire, a vast polity given the rarity of habitable planets. These core worlds are mostly located around mature planets in the outer arms of the Milky Way. Keeping the most distant core worlds tied together with the heart of Antari space is a logistical nightmare that even the dominant intelligence in our galaxy can scarcely manage. Political strife of all kinds, usually derived from conflicting interpretations of interstellar law, is the norm in these outer worlds. Such conflict has repeatedly flared up in the past, provoking multiple brutal civil wars within Antari space, the most recent of which was especially sanguinary.<br><br> Like any other Antari rebellion, the insurgents destroyed or otherwise sabotaged the portal network, protecting them from immediate retribution, buying them time to organize. The punitive response fleet had to travel conventionally, but the expected minor battle between the Imperial Fleet and the rebel-controlled Planetary Defense Grid never happened. Antari leadership was intent on making a permanent example of these malcontents.<br><br> Staying out of weapons range, the Imperial Fleet instead deployed a planetary weapon of mass destruction. They dispersed a layer of dust in a ring around the local star, between it and the planet. Sunlight faded to a hellish twilight at its brightest. This “Dust Siege” quickly led to complete ecosystem failure and societal collapse from the resultant lack of food and power. People slaughtered each other in droves. Imperial command broadcast the madness to other core worlds; a grim reminder of the price of stepping out of line.<br><br> The Antari are not without a sense of morality, even up in the highest military echelons. The ones perpetrating the atrocity were also horrified by it, and they sought alternative means of quenching rebellions. Apocalyptic weapons like black hole generators and thermonuclear bombardment were not viable. Habitable planets are too valuable to extinguish or render unlivable. Viral attacks were explored, but a virus is virtually impossible to control, as runaway mutations and zoonotic transfers to local wildlife often caused similar habitability issues. A breakthrough was made by engineering a large, multicellular organism from scratch to propagate in a viral matter; as a parasite. The vastly-slower pace of evolution and mutation of multicellular life seemed a natural fit – fearsome offensive capability combined with the comparative ease of disposal of the parasites after pacification is achieved.<br><br> Further reading brings you into the layout of the entire facility. There are 4 main structures/departments, arranged in a line.<br> ''Logistics Center'' - Your current location. Houses personnel on-site in the short term and houses the all-important off-world portal, allowing transit of people, goods, and services at such a pace that more or less can hold Antari society together. Personnel do not typically stay at the facility due to the ease of travel, but in case of portal failure, supplies are stockpiled for short-term habitation.<br> ''Breeding Center'' - The next building down the line. Antari criminals are kept here against their will to serve as Werm breeders. Ethically indefensible, but secretly condoned by shadowy elements of Imperial Command as necessary, given their tenuous political situation.<br> ''Genetics Laboratory'' - A facility full of bioincubators, which house new and experimental forms of weaponized parasites.<br> ''Werm Pit'' - Little more than a giant pit to hold all the stockpiled and newly-birthed Werm specimens. At the center of the pit lies a suppression device that uses some form of magnetic resonance to pacify the Werms and keep them from escaping the pit. It also prevents parasitic mergers, keeping them all in a state of arrested development.<br><br> [[Head to the Breeding Center->Antari Breeding Center]]<font size = 4> ''=Logistics Center=''</font><br> <<if $logassault == 1>> Subtlety is not called for right now, a decisive frontal assault should do just fine.<br><br> You huddle together with your minions, quietly choosing targets and attack vectors. Doubt begins to gnaw at you, maybe this was a stupid idea… suddenly, you hear a muffled moan. One of the guards in their cot… there’s motion around their crotch. It’s working! A few moments later, another pair of guards begins to draw closer to each other. They appear to be anxiously flirting.<br><br> The pheromones continue to broadcast. The concentration is increasing. Strangled gasps and moans begin to escape the masturbating guard in their cot. The flirting guards have gotten physical, making out and feeling each other up – their weapons long since forgotten on nearby cots. Perhaps… perhaps a quick attack would- no. Don’t be hasty.<br><br> The minutes march on, and the Antari have begun to lose themselves to hedonism. The overly-affectionate pair degenerated into full-on doggy-style sex, luring the other guards into utter frenzy. You have also begun to masturbate. Once the guards in the impromptu orgy begin to openly scream and shriek in pleasure, you know the time has come. You burst into the room with your followers. The guards barely register their own demise as parasites invade their every hole.<br><br> Now you can investigate the room.<br><br> [[Investigate->Logistic Center Investigate]] <<elseif $logassault == 3>> You weigh your options. Perhaps the guards can be persuaded to do the heavy lifting for you?<br><br> Your team gestates a choker parasite. As it forms, you program it with a set of infiltration instructions. After some time, it is birthed, falling out of a pussy onto its ‘feet’. As menacingly as it can, it clambers into the nearby air duct. You watch through a window, waiting with bated breath, as it slips through an air vent, across the floor, and under the covers of a sleeping guard. A light gasp precedes some movement from the guard. You heart skips a beat. The guard tenses, and then goes slack, their jaw slightly open. Phew. Now for the waiting game.<br><br> Nearly a half hour passes, you and your cohorts idly masturbating as the choker dominates the mind and body of the host guard. Finally, after what felt like the hundredth check-in, the Antari gets out of bed, undoes his hair to hide his choker, walks straight up to another guard, dragging them by the hand to the room you are hiding in with minimal explanation.<br><br> Everyone hides behind the sides of the door at that development. As soon as the door swings open, the choker-infested guard shoves their victim inside, kicks the door closed, and puts them in a full nelson. The rest of your crew grabs each limb and covers their mouth. At first, the guard is too stunned to react, but the gravity of their situation strikes home very quickly. Their eyes go wide with terror, and they begin to futilely thrash as every sort of parasite is unceremoniously crammed wherever it can fit. Each new parasitic appendage is serviced by orifices and canals to more quickly indoctrinate the Antari with pleasure. A few minutes later, the guard is completely under your control. Once their parasites retreat into their body, the newly-converted guard walks out with the first Antari to lead another fresh guard into the room.<br><br> Before long, all the guards are fully infested and under your thumb. You command them to fuck each other as you investigate the room further.<br><br> [[Investigate->Logistic Center Investigate]] <<endif>><font size = 4> ''=Logistics Center=''</font><br> You peer through a dirty window into the building. It appears to be some sort of transportation and rest facility. An expansive hallway dominates the interior, easily wide enough to accommodate vehicles, whose scorch marks litter the floor. On one end of the hallway is clearly a portal, humming with energy and sized for material. The other end leads to some sort of crystalline reticulated door. Like… a garage door? The rest of the building is littered with beds and cots of all varieties, presumably to house whomever comes through the portal. A small duct runs the length of the facility. Four guards are visible, either lying on cots or wandering around.<br><br> <<set $profile = 'default'>> /* Werm Suits: <<=$biosuit_counter.werm>> <br> */ /* PC suit: <<=part2_biosuit('pc', 'show')>><br> */ <<if $biosuit_counter.werm >= 3>> [[Assault Option->Logistics Center Infest][$logassault = 1]]<br> <<else>> <div title="This option requires 3 werm biosuits"> <span class = "inactive"> <a data-passage="Logistics Center Infest" data-setter="$logassault = 1"> Assault Option </a> <br> </span> </div> <</if>> /* Pheromone option requires PC to be wearing a canal suit */ <<if $biosuit_counter.canal >= 2>> [[Pheromone Option->Logistics Center Infest][$logassault = 2]]<br> <<else>> <div title="This option requires 2 canal biosuits"> <span class = "inactive"> <a data-passage="Logistics Center Infest" data-setter="$logassault = 2"> Pheromone Option </a> <br> </span> </div> <</if>> /* Mind Control requires the PC to be wearing a choker biosuit */ <<if $biosuit_counter.choker >= 1>> [[Mind Control Option->Logistics Center Infest][$logassault = 3]]<br> <<else>> <div title="This option requires 1 choker biosuit"> <span class = "inactive"> <a data-passage="Logistics Center Infest" data-setter="$logassault = 3"> Mind Control Option </a> <br> </span> </div> <</if>> <br> <div id="MenuContainer"> <br> <ul id="navigation"> [[Who is here->Antari Portal Room]]<br> </ul> <br> </div> <<audio "homemusic" stop>> <<audio "assault" loop play>><font size = 4> ''=Decisions=''</font><br><br> <<set $host_choice = {}>> You slither across the floor. You were abducted by an alien power, the Antari, as a guinea pig for their latest bioweapon, the Werm. Upon the success of the test run, you were cleansed of your infestation and returned to your dreary and tedious life back on Earth.<br><br> You were not alone, however. An unknown actor provided you with new parasites, which, having nothing better to do with your life, you stuffed into your body and those of the people around you. Within a few weeks, your entire hometown was a warren of Werm, with the infested having essentially overthrown much of local society, from the seediest strip clubs to schools and even shopping malls. Fortunately, your hometown is so irrelevant that nobody else seemed to care.<br><br> Upon the domination of your household, an Antari scientist, Joan, broke into your house and explained that your time aboard the spaceship was a setup, but that he didn’t know who had provided you with parasites when you returned to Earth. When he tried to take you to be de-infested, a family member caught him off-guard, and you infested him.<br><br> Upon his interrogation, with a little help from a Werm inside his brain, you learn where his spaceship was parked. You realized that the hammer was going to come down from the Antari homeworlds if you simply let Rene escape. A portal has opened up in the side of the ship.<br> [[Step through->Antari Portal Room]]<br> [[Not yet->During The Day]]<br><<set _p = $people[$id]>> <<set _vsuit = parasite(_p, "external", {slot: "covering"})>> <<if _vsuit.merged>> ''You try to pry off the biosuit, but it won't come off! <font color = #208B78>It has completely merged with <<call _p true>>'s body and will remain part of <<pro_d _p>> forever.</font>''<br> <<else>> <<set part2_biosuit($id, '')>> /* unset biosuit */ ''You pry the biosuit off of <<call _p true>>'s body.''<br> <<retrieveparasite "pc" _p "external" "covering">> <</if>> [[Continue|$return]]<br><font size = 4> ''=Werm Holding Pit=''</font><br><br> /* you get turned into a werm */ <<set $profile = 'werm'>> <<if $pitassault == 1>> Your wermsuit-clad minions burst through the doors and rapidly advance on the nearest guards, tackling them at full speed and propelling them into the nearest wall. The other guards are stunned for a second, look at each other, then raise their weapons and open fire. Your squad dodges behind pillars and machinery, weaving through the room of advanced equipment, disabling the guards one by one. You pick up a server rack and launch it through the air. It sails above the head of a guard and as they look up, you fly into their ribs feet first. The server rack lands and shatters, carrying its momentum into two other guards and dropping them to the floor. As more damage is done to the equipment, power systems become disconnected. Live wires that used to feed very hungry computing systems are exposed everywhere, creating blue sparking arcs of electricity. <br><br> The rampage continues. They are armed with unusual weapons - not bullets, but some kind of energy wave gun that completely disables any parasites it hits. Your minions turn to attack, but are rapidly struck down. You falter. You - and the werm in your brain - feel the creeping sense of fear climb up your spine. In a raging act of cowardice, you turn and run as your companions fall to the Antari. Rene is very confident, swiftly and efficiently directing her team. She may be a psychopath, but in the heat of battle she seems to be a fine-tuned machine. It's not long before you are the only one left in the room.<br><br> You expect some kind of speech, some gloating and end-of-the-line banter from Rene, who has you surrounded behind some kind of tank full of fluid. What you actually receive is a grenade, lobbed over the tank, which lands at your feet. The werm in your brain quickly reacts, picking up the grenade and slamming it into the tank. It triggers right as it hits the metal wall - but instead of exploding with fire, it emits a strong energy pulse. It's the same kind of energy that disables the werms. However, contact with the weird alien metal of the tank alters the nature of the blast wave. You feel like you get violently ejected, but your body simply slumps to the floor. Liquid pours out of a hole created in the tank where your grenade made contact.<br><br> Rene stands over you. You can barely make out something she is saying to the other Antari - they've set up a portal nearby. The bodies of your minions are being heaped together near the portal entrance. Suddenly, everyone begins to panic and run. The liquid coming from the tank has finally made contact with one of the numerous small fires in the facility - a trail of flame snakes back to the tank and it explodes violently. You are tossed a good 50 feet away, and are thrown out of your body.<br><br> <<elseif $pitassault == 2>> The doors burst open and a hoarde of choker-infested Antari erupts into the room, overwhelming the nearest guards. You can 'see' about ten feet in any direction all at the same time. You can see your body just a few feet away. It's absolutely massive, the size of a house. [[Continue->AntariHouse]]<<endif>><font size = 4> ''=Antari Core World Seneton - Town of Kimelea=''</font><br><br> <<set $return = passage()>> The town is arranged in a double-spiral formation along the axis of a major highway. The glass-steel roads have no specular reflection despite their mineral composition, and stand in dark contrast to the well-lit buildings in the city. Most of the city space is dedicated to transportation infrastructure. The Antari despise traffic with a burning passion. The buildings are mostly made of carbon fiber composites as a way of sequestering carbon to prevent climate change. Antari construction uses so much dense carbon it is actually carbon negative, offsetting the clearcutting in the surrounding farming region. As a result, the Antari have no restrictions on building development and have a glorious, sprawling city center with domes, blocks, and spires creating an intricate and diverse skyline.<br><br> The core world of Seneton pulls vast amounts of resources and luxury goods from fringe worlds and experiences very little unrest. Because of this, most of the inhabitants are hard-working and believe in the Antari empire, but are also slightly apathetic and easily distracted by trivial conflicts, like celebrity drama. There is a boredom brewing under the surface. Large cities relentlesly consume as much accomplishment and purpose as possible, draining motivation from the smaller towns such as Kimelea.<br><br> Locations:<br><br> <div title="Where portals of different sizes are located, some large enough to send starships through"> [[Portal Hub->PortalHub]] </div> <div title="Where Antari fight each other in a ceremonial manner to determine if they get to keep their gender"> [[Arena Of Destiny]] </div> <div title="Where Antari go when they are too lazy to make a meal"> [[Food Dome->FoodDome]] </div> <div title="A large clean building with multiple hologram-field rooms that are capable of generating virtual worlds. Antari are born with both male and female genatalia, and through competition their gender gets assigned at some point after puberty. All Antari have breasts, a penis, and a vagina. Antari females are simply male Antari that have been penetrated after losing a fight. The physical change occurs rapidly after an Antari male ejaculates into the womb. The penis shrinks into a clitoris. The internal gonads change from producing sperm to producing eggs. The breasts expand and muscles atrophy slightly, while body fat increases. Bone structure, however, does not change. Antari that go through the change too late in life are stuck with a masculine body frame. The mental changes are also rapid but take a few weeks to fully solidify. A deep devotion for the victor is instilled in the defeated. The losers brain is flooded with the Antari equivalent of oxytocin and serotonin, along with a few other neurotransmitters, that cause massive pleasure waves and reduce aggression. Their anxiety disappears completely. The shock of this mental change is enough to cause most Antari to instantly accept their new life.<br><br> The Antari realized early on that codifying the transition, and making it into a ceremony, was a necessary step to maintain order in the Antari social structure. The Arena Of Destiny was the conventional accepted method for allowing Antari to compete and transition. At first it was a private affair, usually sending two Antari friends in to a secluded arena and waiting to see who emerged victorious. The pair was then married on the spot and declared off-limits to others. However, unscrupulous individuals would still sometimes attack codified Antari couples, so chastity belts were commonplace in the earliest centuries. Chastity belts are still in use but are generally considered to be a sign of social unrest - a city or town with high chastity belt usage is considered a lower class ghetto.<br><br> The modern Arena Of Destiny contains both public and private arenas, as well as a wedding hall. Arena 'combat' has codified rules to promote better Antari evolution and ensure the fittest and strongest Antari come out on top - figuratively and literally. Strength, speed, intellect, and a little bit of underhanded play are all acceptable methods of establishing dominance. Unacceptable tactics - like poisoning your opponent before the match begins - are grounds for arrest and forced transformation.<br><br> <<room_system 'infestation' _passage>><br> <<if _infestation_stage > 0>> <font color = #208B78>The Arena Of Destiny has been infested.</font><br> <</if>> /*<<if $people.pc.social.fangofight == 1>>[[Enter the Arena with Fango->Arenafango]]<br><<endif>>*/ <<arena_fight>> [[Watch two Antari fight each other->ObserveAntari]]<br><br> [[Sidra's Office->arenaattfemale-room]]<br> [[Ikan's Office->arenaattmale-room]]<br><br> [[Back to town -> AntariTown]]<font size = 4>''=Bathroom=''</font><br><br> [img[$image_dir+"Parasites/Werm_Small.png"][Transgender3]]<br><br> [img[$image_dir+"Parasites/PurpleWermsmall.png"][Transgender]]<br><br> [img[$image_dir+"Parasites/RedWermsmall.png"][Transgender2]]<br><br> [[Continue->P4 Hospital]]<font size = 4> ''=Antari Core World Seneton - Desolate Beach=''</font><br><br> Waves lazily lap at the shoreline here. Before that, all computers relied on atoms as the smallest unit of volume. Arranging neutrons and protons into stable logic gates gave rise to the possibility of reducing computer size by a further 99%. However, the density was roughly on par with a neutron star, and any practical logic system would collapse in upon itself. This issue was solved with the discovery of the euboson, an exotic arrangement of quarks that created a negative graviational field. By arranging a lattice of neutrons and eubosons, protons were used as a signal particle to create the first calculator smaller than an atom. An interpreter read the altered electrical field from the calculator to display the result of operations. Technology with smaller-than-atom computing was named 'Pantech', but sounded horrible to everyone so colloquially it is known as 'Dynotech'.<br><br> This breakthrough led to the dominance of Antari technology and culture in the galaxy for several reasons. The first and foremost was that Antari tech became superior by several orders of magnitude, but equally as important was the fact that it couldn't be reverse engineered. Only a handful of civilizations were near the point of being able to understand this new strata of computer technology and they were the first to be attacked by the new Antari weapons of war.<br><br> However, Antari dominance of the galaxy has clearly been deemed a small price to pay for the new level of luxury that everyone seems to be living in. Medical nanobots, general AI, mind uploading, personal supercomputers - these are some of the many benefits we all share in this new age.<br><br> %% End Excerpt<br><br> <<back>>Joan waves the gun and motions you to sit down. Triggers ((PC Kitchen event))"*/ /* NPC Infestation Event */ <<set $talk.questions[8][0] = "Do you want to stay in my house tonight?">> /*If Trust > 90, $id will be at PC house at nighttime. "Sure - scared of sleeping alone? Haha..." else "Mmmm... I have other things to do..."*/ /* Trust Manipulation Between NPC's */ <<set $talk.questions[9][0] = "I think ____ ">> <<set $talk.questions[9][1] = "is acting strangely. Have you noticed anything?">> /* Trust Manipulation Between NPC's */ <<set $talk.questions[10][0] = "Have you seen ">> /* "____ ..." */ <<set $talk.questions[10][1] = "hanging around the generator a lot?">> <<set $talk.questions[10][2] = "hanging around the water pump a lot?">> <</if>> <<set _passage = passage()>> <<set _pc = $game.entities.cur_identity>> <<set _npc = ($id != undefined && gethost($id) != undefined)? $id:'boss'>> <<set _options = $talk.options>> <<set console.log(`pc_npc`, _pc, _npc)>> <<set _trust = (gethost($id) != undefined)?gethost($id).social[_pc].trust:$missions.people[_npc].social[_pc].trust>> <<set _questions = $talk.questions>> <<if _options[0] == undefined>> <<for _i = 0; _i < Object.keys(_questions).length; _i++>> <<if $talk.time[_i] == $time || $talk.time[_i] == ''>> <<set _text = _questions[_i][0]>> <<if _i == 9 || _i == 10>> <<set _text += "...">><</if>> <<if (_i != 2 && $memory.events.generator.id == undefined) || (_i != 3 && $memory.events.waterpump.id == undefined)>> <<print "<<link \""+_text+"\" '" +_passage +"'>> <<set $talk.options[0] = "+_i+">><</link>><br>">> <</if>> <</if>> <</for>> <<else>> <<if $talk.long_question == ''>> <<set $talk.long_question = _questions[_options[0]][0]>> <</if>> /*<<set _text = _questions[_options[0]][0]>> <<speech _pc _text>>*/ <<speech _pc $talk.long_question>> <</if>> /* Talk about the chosen subject */ <<switch _options[0]>> <<case 0>> /* 1 - Available in the morning only */ <<set _text = current_name($missions.participants[0], 'missions')+' and '+current_name($missions.participants[1], 'missions')+' are going on the next mission '>> <<if $missions.type == 'supply'>> <<set _text += "and they are going to steal supplies from a government outpost.">> <<elseif $missions.type == 'rescue'>> <<set _text += "and they are going to rescue one of the prisoners you talked about.">> <<elseif $missions.type == 'recon'>> <<set _text += "and they are going to find one of the prisoners you talked about.">> <</if>> <<speech _npc _text>> <<set $talk.end = true>> <<case 1>> /* 2 - Available in the morning only */ <<if _trust > 90>> /* TODO: add a choice for whom to replace */ <<speech _npc "Sure thing, I'll add you on-">> <<set $mission.participants[0] = _pc>> <<else>> <<speech _npc "No, I don't trust that you'll come back in one piece.">> <</if>> <<set $talk.end = true>> <<case 2>> /* 3 - Available any time */ <<if _trust > 50>> <<speech _npc "Okay - I'll head over there now.">> <<set $memory.events.generator.time = $time, $memory.events.generator.id = _npc>> <<else>> <<speech _npc "Stop messing around, I've got work to do.">> <</if>> <<case 3>> <<if _trust > 50>> <<speech _npc "Okay - I'll head over there now.">> <<set $memory.events.waterpump.time = $time, $memory.events.waterpump.id = _npc>> <<else>> <<speech _npc "Stop messing around, I've got work to do.">> <</if>> <<case 4>> <<set _text = "The jail prisoner has been locked up for a while. He... she... used to be part of the resistance but got infested during one of our missions. Max used to be the leader here, but now he's... she's... just a mind-controlled servant of the aliens. Nobody has the heart to actually take her life so we decided to lock her up until we really knew that there wasn't a way to reverse the infestation.">> <<speech _npc _text>> <<if _options[1] === undefined>> <<for _i = 1; _i < Object.keys(_questions[4]).length; _i++>> <<print "<<link \""+$talk.questions[4][_i]+"\" '" +_passage +"'>> <<set $talk.options[1] = "+_i+">><</link>><br>">> <</for>> <<else>> <<set _text = _questions[_options[0]][_options[1]]>> <<speech _pc _text>> <<if _trust > 90>> <<speech _npc "Oh wow, thats amazing! We should make that our next mission!">> <<set $mission.participants[0] = _pc>> <<set $mission.participants[1] = _npc>> <<else>> <<speech _npc "Psh... that sounds ridiculous">> <</if>> <</if>> <<case 5>> /* <<if _options[1] === undefined>> <<set _extra = "<<social_stat_modify "+_npc+" "+_pc+" 'trust' 5>>">> <<if $talk.questions[5][_npc] !== undefined>> <<for _i = 1; _i < Object.keys(_questions[5][_npc]).length; _i++>> <<print "<<link \""+$talk.questions[5][_npc][_i]+"\" '" +_passage +"'>> <<set $talk.options[1] = "+_i+">>"+_extra+"<</link>><br>">> <</for>> <</if>> <</if>>*/ <<if $talk.questions[5][_npc] !== undefined>> /* TODO: shift array, so that the empty value will be replaced and won't break the dialogues */ /* create a macro <<monologue_continous array_with_phrases>> */ <<set _foo = Math.floor(Math.random() * $talk.questions[5][_npc].length)>> <<set _text = $talk.questions[5][_npc][_foo]>> <<set $talk.mono_continuous[$talk.mono_continuous.length] = _text>> <<for _i = 0; _i < $talk.mono_continuous.length; _i++>> <<print "<<speech "+_npc+" \""+$talk.mono_continuous[_i]+"\">>">> <</for>> <<link 'Continue' _passage>> <<set delete $talk.questions[5][_npc][_foo]>> <<social_stat_modify _npc _pc 'trust' 5>> /* stat modification */ <</link>><br> <</if>> <<case 6>> <<speech _npc "I have some spare time, sure.">> <<if $talk.questions[6] !== undefined && $talk.questions[6].length > 1>> /* TODO: shift array, so that the empty value will be replaced and won't break the dialogues */ /* create a macro <<monologue_continous array_with_phrases>> */ <<set _foo = Math.floor(Math.random() * $talk.questions[6].length) + 1>> <<set _text = $talk.questions[6][_foo]>> <<set $talk.mono_continuous[$talk.mono_continuous.length] = _text>> <<for _i = 0; _i < $talk.mono_continuous.length; _i++>> <<print "<<speech "+_pc+" \""+$talk.mono_continuous[_i]+"\">>">> <</for>> <<link 'Continue' _passage>> <<set delete $talk.questions[6][_foo]>> <<social_stat_modify _npc _pc 'trust' 5>> /* stat modification */ <</link>><br> <</if>> <<case 7>> /* TODO: <<If $id == infected && horny*>> how is 'horny' defined */ <<if infested($people[_npc])>> <<speech _npc "Yes, I could use your help... in my house...">> <<else>> <<speech _npc "Depends on what you can do.">> <<if _options[1] === undefined>> <<for _i = 1; _i < Object.keys(_questions[7]).length; _i++>> <<print "<<link \""+$talk.questions[7][_i]+"\" '" +_passage +"'>> <<set $talk.options[1] = "+_i+">><</link>><br>">> <</for>> <</if>> <</if>> <<case 8>> <<if _trust > 90 && $memory.night_visitor == undefined>> <<speech _npc "Sure - scared of sleeping alone? Haha...">> <<set $memory.night_visitor = _npc>> /* TODO: <<set $id to be at PC house at nighttime. Make this conversation unavailable to anyone else.>>*/ <<else>> <<speech _npc "Mmmm... I have other things to do...">> <</if>> <<set $talk.end = true>> <<case 9>> /* TODO: $talk.interest - id of NPC that is the subject of the question */ <<if $talk.interest == undefined>> <<for _i = 0; _i < npcs().length; _i++>> <<set _name = current_name(npcs()[_i])>> <<print "<<link \""+_name+"\" '" +_passage +"'>> <<set $talk.long_question += ' "+_name+" ', $talk.interest = '"+npcs()[_i]+"'>><</link>><br>">> <</for>> <<else>> <<if $talk.long_question_end == false>> <<for _i = 1; _i < Object.keys(_questions[9]).length; _i++>> <<set _text = $talk.questions[9][_i]>> <<print "<<link \""+_text+"\" '" +_passage +"'>> <<set $talk.long_question += \""+_text+"\", $talk.long_question_end = "+true+">><</link>><br>">> <</for>> <</if>> <</if>> <<case 10>> /* TODO: $talk.interest - id of NPC that is the subject of the question */ <<if $talk.interest == undefined>> <<for _i = 0; _i < npcs().length; _i++>> <<set _name = current_name(npcs()[_i])>> <<print "<<link \""+_name+"\" '" +_passage +"'>> <<set $talk.long_question += ' "+_name+" ', $talk.interest = '"+npcs()[_i]+"'>><</link>><br>">> <</for>> <<else>> <<if $talk.long_question_end == false>> <<for _i = 1; _i < Object.keys(_questions[10]).length; _i++>> <<set _text = $talk.questions[10][_i]>> <<print "<<link \""+_text+"\" '" +_passage +"'>> <<set $talk.long_question += \""+_text+"\", $talk.long_question_end = "+true+">><</link>><br>">> <</for>> <</if>> <</if>> <<default>> /* if countinuous talking - make a hint that the NPC is eager to listen or is annoyed */ <</switch>><br> <<if _options[1] !== undefined && (_options[0] != 4 || _options[0] != 9 || _options[0] != 10)>> <<set _text = _questions[_options[0]][_options[1]]>> <<speech _pc _text>> <</if>> <<if $talk.end == false>> <<link 'Lost my thought. See you later' 'Enclave'>><<set delete $talk>><</link>> <<else>> <<link 'Finish dialogue' 'Enclave'>><<set delete $talk>><</link>> <</if>><font size = 4>''=During The Day=''</font><br><br> <<day_cycle>> <<=change_npc_passage_visibility()>> <<npc_missions>> <<if $game_over>> [[Continue->Caught]] <<else>> [[Continue->Enclave]] <<endif>><font size = 4>''=During The Night=''</font><br><br> <<night_cycle>> <<=change_npc_passage_visibility()>> <<npc_missions>> /* Birthing Check and Exit */ <br><br>After a night untroubled by dreams, [[you awaken->Enclave]].<font size = 4>''=Part 5 - Return to Earth=''</font><br><br> <<set _pc = $people[$game.entities.cur_identity]>> You return to Earth. It has been over a year since your departure. After your consciousness was transferred into a werm body, you have infested an Antari town on one of their core worlds and obtained technology to transfer consciousness between a werm and a host organism. You are being actively pursued by one of the lead researchers of the bioweapon project responsible for the Werm - a sentient race of enslaved parasites created by the Antari for the express purpose of suppressing rebellions and creating mindless obedient drones. One of the other high ranking researchers - Joan - has been enslaved by you. Her whereabouts are unknown. After having multiple encounters on the Antari world, you were sucked into a plot hole. It was a big one - large enough to have its own gravitational field. However, after mind-swapping back to your original body you were able to crawl out.<br><br> The body you inhabit is completely purged of parasites - except that your intestines and anal cavity have been stuffed with a werm, a canal, a pair of starfish, and a choker egg.<br><br> The whole planet has become infested with parasites. They have wermed their way into the highest levels of authority and have taken over human society, uniting everyone in blissful obedience.<br><br> As you walk through the city, you see large billboards everywhere with the slogan "Stronger Together" and "We Need Each Other". Smiling faces of the infested plaster the streets, television, and the internet as the werms attempt to convince any remaining uninfested people that life is better once they give in to the hivemind.<br><br> But behind the calm, passive public demeanor there is chaos brewing. The werms were designed to enslave, not to rule. Having taken over human society, they have quickly discovered just how bad they are at actually ''managing'' human society. Large collective systems fail catastrophically on an almost daily basis. Famines begin to appear in societies that had long forgotten it was even possible to run out of food. Power and transportation are intermittant even in large cities, and shortsighted panic-driven solutions are the standard operating mode for the new werm governance.<br><br> In short, things are going to hell very quickly.<br><br> This is the situation that greets you on your return to your home planet.<br><br> <<storeparasite _pc 'werm'>> <<storeparasite _pc 'canal'>> <<storeparasite _pc 'starfish'>> <<storeparasite _pc 'choker' 'egg'>> [[Danger approaches->EarthReturn2]]<font size = 4>''=Part 5 - Return to Earth=''</font><br><br> As you walk through the suburbs of a major city in Asia, a large van begins following you. A voice booms through the air - <br><br> <<speech 'boss' "Unregistered human - stop or be fired upon!">> You break out into a sprint. The top of the van opens up and a large breasted woman emerges dressed in a skimpy uniform. She pulls out a large assault rifle and starts shooting at you. Branches of nearby trees explode as bullets rip through the air - you trip and fall into a pile of leaves next to a motorcycle. ''The psychic disruption grenade falls out of your pocket.'' The van stops - but suddenly another engine can be heard nearby. Your assailants shout wildly as multiple weapons are discharged all around you - from your vantage point in the leaf pile you can see absolutely nothing.<br><br> Suddenly your arm is grabbed by a strong set of hands, and you are hoisted out of the foliage. Two people drag you to a janky looking car - you look over to the van to see three dead women on the ground around it.<br><br> <<speech 'fighter1' "Come on, you're gonna be alright - you've got to get out of here!">> They toss you into the car and take off as sirens wail in the distance. Four of you are in the car - the two who grabbed you and a driver. The vehicle speeds off, following a dirt road deep into the woods.<br><br> [[The Resistance->EarthReturn3]]<font size = 4>''=Part 5 - Return to Earth=''</font><br><br> <<speech 'mechanic2' "What a fight - your shooting is downright devastating Arnold!">> <<speech 'fighter1' "Yes - did you see how fast I got to that choppa? Haha - I also thought it was funny - funny when that sergeant tried to shoot that bullpup. It was like watching baby-">> <<speech 'engineer' "Hey both of you shut up - we need to find out why they were chasing this girl. Also, check her for parasites. Can't be too careful.">> You, Arnold, and two other mysterious individuals are still driving into the darkness. The sun is going down and the road is bumpy, but you are still moving fast enough that you don't even contemplate opening the door and jumping out of the car. Your rescuers grab you and roughly check your body - groping you quickly and awkwardly in your private areas to check that you aren't carrying extra anatomy. They seem embarassed about it. The lack of good lighting and awkwardness of the search prevents them from noticing the thin slit on the back of your neck.<br><br> <<speech 'engineer' "You seem clean - but it's so weird, I've never seen an uninfested person wandering around that close to the city before. Did you escape from a detention facility?">> <<speech 'pc' "I uh... I don't remember. I don't know how I got there or why those people were chasing me...">> <<speech 'engineer' "Hey I've seen this before - its drug induced amnesia. Those goddamn parasites have been experimenting on people, maybe she escaped somehow? Some kind of secret detention facility in the burbs? I wouldn't put it past them...">> <<speech 'mechanic2' "Hold up - whats the last thing you remember?">> There's no way you can come up with any kind of believable cover story. You've been away for so long that you have no information about anything that has happened recently. Unless...<br><br> <<speech 'pc' "I... what? Parasites? What are you talking about?">> <<speech 'mechanic2' "Holy crap - were you taken before the invasion?!">> [[What happened?->EarthReturn4]]<font size = 4>''=Part 5 - Return to Earth=''</font><br><br> <<speech 'engineer' "I'll start from the invasion.<br><br> About six months ago, almost all world leaders and militaries united together - against the people of earth. We don't know how long the infestation had been going on but apparently 95% of the military and political class had become infested by these... parasites. The war lasted about a week, if you could even call it a war. A couple nukes were launched but apparently they had infested most of the worlds nuclear arsenals. Kiev and Detroit were wiped off the map but for the most part the rest of the world has remained intact - but under the alien control. Millions are enslaved every week as the parasites move out from the cities into the rural areas. We are part of the resistance, free people dedicated to finding a way of wiping out the parasites and taking back our planet. Our numbers have grown substantially ever since it became apparent that these parasites were not part of some larger invasion. For a while, we were waiting for alien ships to descend out of the sky and wipe the noninfested out, and I think the parasites were expecting that too. I don't have much hope of using our weapons against some kind of alien death ray, but apparently it looks like it's just these mind controlling parasites that we have to deal with. They have to fight using our technology - and that means we can beat them.">> <<speech 'fighter1' "We are strong, but we are few - that's why we have to find and rescue as many uninfested people as possible. One thing about the parasites - they are terrible at living. The infested can be sneaky but in a straight up fight they can only win when they have extremely overwhelming numbers. In a fair fight we dominate - dooominate - every time.">> <<speech 'engineer' "It's something about their mentality. They have perfect unity but cannot think outside the box, and seem afraid of taking initiative.">> <<speech 'mechanic2' "Anyway - we're glad to have you on board. ''There's only ten of us here'', but everyone in the resistance pulls their weight, even if they aren't a fighter. I'm sure you're good at something. Oh - it looks like we've arrived.">> [[Welcome to The Enclave->EarthReturn5]]<font size = 4>''=The Enclave - Arrival=''</font><br><br> You were expecting a ramshackle group of tents, but this seems like a fortress. Camoflauged earthen and timber walls protect houses that look like dirt bunkers. There's a noise-protected ''generator room'' with split exhaust to hide the heat signature and disperse any smoke. ''Five houses'' form a ring in the center of the camp, with a ''kitchen'' area over to the side. ''Three watchtowers'' guard the perimeter. There is a communal ''shower and bathroom area'' as well. The water is supplied by a ''water pump'' near the edge of the camp, housed in its own dirt covered building to reduce noise generation.<br><br> The true extent of the work involved in setting up this encampent is lost on your pathetically ignorant brain. But you don't care.<br><br> <font color = orange>''Feature Changes (currently under construction)<br><br> You will have a limited parasite inventory. The parasites are stored inside of your body. Any additional parasites you pick up are lost, crawling or slithering away into the wild only to succumb to the elements. You can store parasites at certain locations - places where you can merge and combine parasites or mutate them. It was kind of weird to be able to hold like 500 starfish on you at any time.<br><br> Specific Infestations:<br><br> It will be possible to turn NPC characters into werms in part 5. You can then use them for infestations in specific body parts. The game will keep track of unique werms in specific slots.<br><br> Parasite Mutations:<br><br> After such a long time on Earth, exposed to the extreme biodiversity of the planet, the parasites have begun to mutate. Strange sub-species evolutions will emerge with odd traits that have never been seen before. The werm biosuit allows the player to mutate parasites in their womb based on the semen ejaculated into them.<br><br> ''</font> [[Continue->Enclave]]<br><br> <font size = 4 color = red>''Mission 1 should be working. Parasite mutations have been implemented. Next priority is to finish the missions and get art for the main character body alterations.''</font><font size = 4>''=The Enclave=''</font><br><br> <<set _pc_id = $game.entities.cur_identity>> <<set _passage = passage()>> <<set $home_passage = _passage>> <<=time_label($time)>> of day <<=$day+1>>.<br> You stand in the Enclave, one of the last bastions of the Resistance in this area. It is a well protected and well camoflauged encampment deep in the woods, far from prying eyes.<br><br> <font color = orange>Detection Threat : </font> <<if _freeze>> <font color = <<if $debug_mode == true>> <<debugger 'Enclave' $people[_pc_id]>> <</if>> <<if $people[$game.entities.cur_identity] == undefined>> <<goto 'Missions'>> <</if>><font size = 4>''=The Enclave - Generator=''</font><br><br> <<set _passage = passage()>> <<if $flags[$chapter].generator == undefined>><<set $flags[$chapter].generator = 1>><</if>> <<set _generator = $flags[$chapter].generator>> The generator supplies electricity to the entire camp. At nighttime, it powers the ''lights'' in the houses and watchtowers.<br><br> <<if $memory.events.generator.id != undefined>> <<set _npc = $memory.events.generator.id>> <<set _pc = $game.entities.cur_identity>> <<set _prev_loc = $people[_npc].location>> <<movehere _npc>> <<if _generator == 1>> <<speech _npc "Why did you call me here? The generator is fine!">> <<=current_name(_npc)>> lost 20 trust towards <<=current_name(_pc)>>.<br> <<social_stat_modify _npc _pc 'trust' -20>> <<move _npc _prev_loc>> <<elseif _generator == 0>> <<speech _npc "Let me take a look at it...">> <<=current_name(_npc)>> gained 5 trust towards <<=current_name(_pc)>>.<br> <<social_stat_modify _npc _pc 'trust' 5>> <span id="ReleasePheromones"> <<click "Release pheromones">> <<replace "#ReleasePheromones">> +10 to <<=current_name(_npc)>>'s perversion <br> <<=current_name(_npc)>> starts the generator <br> <<set $people[_npc].stats.base.perversion += 10>> <<set $memory.events.generator = {id: undefined, time: undefined}>> <<set $flags[$chapter].generator = 1>> <<move _npc _prev_loc>> <</replace>> <</click>> </span><br> <<if parasite_has($people.pc, "choker")>> <span id="ChokerInfest"> <<click "Infest <<=current_name(_npc)>> with a choker parasite">> <<replace "#ChokerInfest">> <<set _choker = parasite_retrieve($people.pc, "choker")>> <<infest $people.pc $people[_npc] "neck" _choker>> <<=current_name(_npc)>>'s neck was infested with a choker parasite <br> <<=current_name(_npc)>> starts the generator <br> <<set $memory.events.generator = {id: undefined, time: undefined}>> <<set $flags[$chapter].generator = 1>> <<move _npc _prev_loc>> <</replace>> <</click>> </span><br> <</if>> <br> <</if>> <</if>> <<if _generator == 1>>[[Turn power off->EnclaveGenerator][$flags[$chapter].generator = 0]]<br><br> <<elseif _generator == 0>>[[Turn power on->EnclaveGenerator][$flags[$chapter].generator = 1]]<br><br><</if>> <<npc_links>><br> [[Enclave]]<font size = 4>''=The Enclave - Kitchen=''</font><br><br> The kitchen area is for food preparation and distribution. It's in a very visible location and typically sees a lot of traffic.<br><br> <<npc_links>><br> [[Enclave]]<font size = 4>''=The Enclave - Medical Bunker=''</font><br><br> The medical bunker is a centrally located mound of dirt with a hole carved out of the middle. The inner drywalls are the best in the entire facility, and look like they've been sealed with epoxy or silicon. It is estimated that every year approximately 1 million people are killed by P. falciparum, especially in Africa where this species predominates. P. falciparum can cause severe malaria because it multiples rapidly in the blood, and can thus cause severe blood loss (anemia). In addition, the infected parasites can clog small blood vessels. When this occurs in the brain, cerebral malaria results, a complication that can be fatal.<br> P. vivax, which is found mostly in Asia, Latin America, and in some parts of Africa. Because of the population densities especially in Asia it is probably the most prevalent human malaria parasite. P. vivax (as well as P. ovale) has dormant liver stages ("hypnozoites") that can activate and invade the blood ("relapse") several months or years after the infecting mosquito bite.<br> P. ovale is found mostly in Africa (especially West Africa) and the islands of the western Pacific. It is biologically and morphologically very similar to P. vivax. However, differently from P. vivax, it can infect individuals who are negative for the Duffy blood group, which is the case for many residents of sub-Saharan Africa. This explains the greater prevalence of P. ovale (rather than P. vivax ) in most of Africa.<br> P. malariae, found worldwide, is the only human malaria parasite species that has a quartan cycle (three-day cycle). (The three other species have a tertian, two-day cycle.) If untreated, P. malariae causes a long-lasting, chronic infection that in some cases can last a lifetime. In some chronically infected patients P. malariae can cause serious complications such as the nephrotic syndrome.<br> P. knowlesi is found throughout Southeast Asia as a natural pathogen of long-tailed and pig-tailed macaques. It has recently been shown to be a significant cause of zoonotic malaria in that region, particularly in Malaysia. P. knowlesi has a 24-hour replication cycle and so can rapidly progress from an uncomplicated to a severe infection; fatal cases have been reported." - US Center for Disease Control<br><br> [img[$image_dir+"Other/Cells2.png"]]<br><br> Malaria has been with the human race for its entire evolutionary existence, and has been said to have killed one out of every two humans that ever existed. While that number can't be definitivly proven, malaria has historically dwarfed all other infectious diseases in terms of human death. If that assumption is anywhere close to reality, it is mind boggling. Create two categories in your mind - one containing all problems all humans have ever experienced except malaria, and the other category is malaria. Those two categories are roughly the same size. What the fuck.<br><br> Some forms of malaria can be completely cured, while others have a dormant state in the liver. Curing malaria has waxed and waned over the past decades - new cures have been discovered, only to have the parasite gain immunity to those cures. Treatment in developed nations usually consists of using several different drugs to attack the parasite simultaneously. Malaria mortality rate in the developed world dropped severely after World War 2 and the litany of technological advances birthed from that conflict. Up until then, it was one of the largest killers of humans.<br><br> [img[$image_dir+"Other/land05.jpg"]]<br><br> The worst impacts of malaria are currently sequestered to Africa. Political instability and a heavy mosquito population make the disease very difficult to control over there. However, just because malaria is currently not an issue in developed countries doesn't mean it has been cured. Because of their complexity, parasites have greater ability to evolve drug resistances and maintain those resistances than bacteria or viruses. ''The malaria parasite has evolved resistances to several anti-malarial drugs already and may become resistant to multilayer treatments in the future.''<br><br> [[Back->Bathroom]]<br> <<audio "background" stop>> <<audio "dream" loop play volume .4>><font size = 4>''=What is a parasite?=''</font><br><br> Parasites are biologically defined as organisms that engage in a relationship such that the parasite benefits while the other organism is harmed.<br><br> 1) A parasite requires the cooperation (typically unwilling) of the host organism<br> 2) A parasite must acquire value<br> 3) A parasite must harm the host organism<br><br> Suppose you are on a basketball team. You cannot function without the other players - does this make you a parasite? Not necessarily. You would have to be hurting the team in some way. A terrible player - a player that contributes much less value than other team members - technically could be called parasitic. The player is parasitic relative to other players that are on the team. But what if he contributes a little bit of value, even if it is the least? The worst player is only relatively parasitic - it is assumed they could contribute more, so the 'lost value' is interpreted as harm. However, in order to be absolutely parasitic, they would have to contribute negative value to the team. The team would need to be better off if that player wasn't even on the team at all. As in, if they went onto the court with 4 people instead of 5, they would get a higher score.<br><br> Consider a farm of cows. Humans eat the cows for food and use their milk. Is this a parasitic relationship? Only if the cows would have had a better life in the wild as compared to living on the farm. Often what a farm provides is security, healthcare, and a stable food supply - things typically unavailable in the wild - which means that the farmers relationship to the cow is symbiotic, not parasitic.<br><br> [[Back->Lower Bathroom]]<br> <<audio "homemusic" stop>> <<audio "dream" loop volume 0.2 play>><font size = 4>''=The Parasite Fetish and Sex=''</font><br><br> I think parasitism is a fetish for those people who do not believe sex is the purpose of life. It is a bit paradoxical, but if you think that your life purpose is to accomplish something big, or to help move the world forward, or think up some new idea, then the entire sexual drive becomes a massive distraction. A relentless whisper in your ear driving you to abandon your plans and become a breeding machine.<br><br> The parallels of a parasite driving you to become horny and the human body's natural instinct to push you toward sex are unmistakeable.<br><br> But maybe that is not necessarily a bug, but a feature? Only the best plans could possibly hope to compete against the instinct of sex. It creates a force of competition that weeds out people with bad ideas, tossing them into the breeding pool. And that brings up another question. Is having children a state of success or failure? You can make an argument either way. Having children clearly means you are evolutionarily successful. But having children with the wrong person is a mark of failure. You've settled. You've given up. You've stopped trying to do that other thing, and now you're in the nesting phase of life. But you've made it TO the nesting phase of life, which is a success in itself. I know people who, were they still alive today, would have been very grateful to settle with some basic bitch or simple man and raise a family.<br><br> It calls. All day, every day. The hedonism of sex. The simplicity of it. //It's simple//, it whispers. So simple. Just relax, let it happen. It's good. Everyone else agrees it is good. Just have sex. You don't need to worry. You don't need to bash your head against that wall anymore. Just stop treading water and let yourself sink down into it. It is right. It is correct. It is what you must do. Procreate.<br><br> But you fight back. You might never silence the whispering, the incessant voice calling to you. But the mere fact that you WANT to stop it is enough. You know you haven't given up yet. Let it whisper. Let it cry out. You can persevere.<br><br> I'd also like to add - there are people out there saying that babies are parasites. This is not a good way of looking at the phenomena of reproduction. Babies are not parasites, they are the future. I think the people who call babies parasites are just expressing stress and frustration at something else going wrong in their life. <font size = 3>''Parasite pornography:''</font><br><br> Porn can be either fantasy or reality replacement. I see dating sims and vanilla porn as reality replacement - you could theoretically have these things, but its easier to just look at porn. Tentacle sex, size change, robot transformation, parasites, and magic fall into the domain of fantasy - there is no physical way anyone on the planet could have these things no matter how hard they tried, at least with current technology. When I look at reality replacement porn I feel bad, I feel guilty, I feel like I'm taking some kind of shortcut. When I look at fantasy porn I just feel horny, no guilt at all because I know what I'm seeing is not a product of laziness. Parasites in porn are typically not portrayed very well. They get too realistic. Real parasites are not sexy - they never have been and I don't think they ever will be. There is blood. There is puss. There is oozing fluid and itching rashes. And some attention whore out there is going to pretend to get off on this stuff but the reality is these things are not sexy. The tendrils are often too spindly, they include bony appendages or other biologically accurate structures which would make sense scientifically but they give me a cringy feeling in regard to sexual stimulation.<br><br> Some of the parasites in this game are modified versions of real parasites. The werm is a parasitic flatworm. The canals are based off of Cymothoa, a parasite that eats and replaces a fish tongue. The modifications were to fatten and shorten their appendages and make them a bit 'fatty' on the surface. The same modifications have been applied to many of the human/alien bodies depicted in this game. The limbs are thicker, more muscular and round rather than lanky and pointy.<br><br> I think it looks fantastic, and while I don't think its possible to engineer something like the werm parasite in the near future, I think that if someone was to try it this would be the ideal shape to go for.<br><br> <<back>> <<audio "homemusic" stop>> <<audio "dream" loop volume 0.2 play>><font size = 4>''=Toxoplasma Gondii=''</font><br><br> Toxoplasmosis is a parasitic disease caused by Toxoplasma gondii. Infections with toxoplasmosis usually cause no obvious symptoms in adults. Occasionally there may be a few weeks or months of mild flu-like illness such as muscle aches and tender lymph nodes. In a small number of people, eye problems may develop. In those with a weak immune system, severe symptoms such as seizures and poor coordination may occur. If infected during pregnancy, a condition known as congenital toxoplasmosis may affect the child.<br><br> [img[$image_dir+"Other/Cells1.png"]]<br><br> For women of childbearing age, a survey of 99 studies within 44 countries found the areas of highest prevalence are within Latin America (about 50–80%), parts of Eastern and Central Europe (about 20–60%), the Middle East (about 30–50%), parts of Southeast Asia (about 20–60%), and parts of Africa (about 20–55%). The US has a roughly 7% infection rate.<br><br> There are three types of Toxoplasma parasite:<br> Type I: virulent in mice and humans, seen in AIDS patients.<br> Type II: non-virulent in mice, virulent in humans (mostly Europe and North America), seen in AIDS patients.<br> Type III: non-virulent in mice, virulent mainly in animals but seen to a lesser degree in humans as well.<br><br> Infection by T Gondii causes rats to change their behavior, becoming more attracted to cats and thus easier to prey on. They become extremely attracted to the smell of cats. It is postulated that this parasite also affects human disposition toward cats. There are many cases of toxoplasma apparently causing schizophrenia, dementia, and other neurological disorders. It has been linked to "crazy cat lady" syndrome. Heavy Toxoplasma infection is also thought to partially cause higher levels of violence and aggression in a given region.<br><br> Trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole is used to prevent infection, but once infection occurs there is no cure. However - ELQ-300, an experimental drug against malaria, has shown some effect on the toxoplasma parasite post-infection. Toxoplasmosis only causes about 750 deaths per year in the US, compared to 400-4000 cases of infection. About half of the deaths are from eating toxoplasma contaminated food, making it one of the leading causes of food poisoning deaths. Once infected, it doesn't do much until the immune system starts to degrade.<br><br> [[Continue->Upstairs Bathroom]]<br> <<audio "homemusic" stop>> <<audio "dream" loop volume 0.2 play>><<set _room = $rooms[passage()]>> <font size = 4> =Always 19=</font><br><br> <<movehere $people.pc>> This is a store dedicated to clothing fit for legally aged consenting adults engaging in fashionable trends.<br><br> Store patronage: 34 per day<br> Assets: lots of 18+ year old women<br><br> <<if _room.infected == false>> One female employee stands behind the counter.
